triples.s: EE261: The Fourier Transform and Its Applications

evidence: Stanford University offers an excellent course titled 'EE261: The Fourier Transform and Its Applications'.
The book is over 400 pages long. Don't feel overwhelmed. You absolutely do not need to cover all of it.
For our purposes, reading even 80-100 pages from selected sections will be more than enough to reinforce your understanding.
The Stanford course takes the reverse order. Both are valid-but here, we start with linear systems to better prepare for their applications in imaging modalities like CT and MRI.
